alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett; Johnston; Sampson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 30 at 1:52PM EDT until April 30 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Sampson County in central North Carolina... Southeastern Harnett County in central North Carolina... Central Cumberland County in central North Carolina... Southwestern Johnston County in central North Carolina... * Until 230 PM EDT. * At 151 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Godwin to 9 miles north of Jerome to near White Oak, moving northeast at 50 mph. This storm has a history of producing 51 mph winds at Fayetteville Regional Airport. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Clinton, Dunn, Benson, Godwin, Erwin, Eastover, Roseboro, Stedman and Newton Grove. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
